body: @amihaiemil please pay attention to this new issue.

issue.title: Unit tests should stop MkGrizzlyContainer in finally block

repository.name: jcabi-github
repository.description: Java Object-Oriented Wrapper of GitHub API, with a fake implementation of the entire GitHub API (for your tests)

issue.body:
There are number of tests in repo, which are using MkGrizzlyContainer.
Some of them are calling container in `try` block and stop the container in finally `block`
(such as `RtCollaboratorsTest.userCanBeAddedAsCollaborator()` )
But some of them just stop the container without any try/finally (such as `RtCollaboratorsTest.canIterate` ). This may lead to resource leaking if some exception is thrown in the middle of the test.

Let's fix them all.

issue.title: RtGistCommentsTest.java:51-52: Continue to close grizzle...

If you have any technical questions, don't ask me, submit new tickets instead. The task will be \"done\" when the problem is fixed and the text of the puzzle is _removed_ from the source code. Here is more about [PDD](http://www.yegor256.com/2009/03/04/pdd.html) and [about me](http://www.yegor256.com/2017/04/05/pdd-in-action.html).

issue.title: For #1482: Use try-with-resource on grizzly containers

repository.name: jcabi-github
repository.description: Java Object-Oriented Wrapper of GitHub API, with a fake implementation of the entire GitHub API (for your tests)

issue.body:
For #1482:
- Replaced try-catch-finally with try-with-resources in `RtGitignoresTest`, `RtHookTest`, `RtHooksTest`, `RtIssueTest`, `RtIssuesTest`, `RtJsonTest`, `RtLabelTest`, `RtLabelsTest`, `RtMarkdownTest` and `RtMarkdownTest`
- Left puzzle for continuing implementation

body: The puzzle `1473-e726d1aa` has disappeared from the source code, that's why I closed this issue. //cc @amihaiemil
